Package server.RMIHandler

Class ConnectionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • server.RMIHandler.ConnectionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InterfaceConnectionHandler, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    public class ConnectionHandler
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements InterfaceConnectionHandler
    ConnectionHandler is used to manage the incoming connections from new or already registered clients. This is a class that extends UnicastRemoteObject, giving the possibility to be used from the client side
    Author:
    edoardo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.rmi.server.RemoteObject

        ref

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConnectionHandler()
      Default constructor, it builds all the data structures used to trace all the connections

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      InterfaceServerControllerRMI askForConnection​(InterfaceClientControllerRMI clientController, java.lang.String nickname)
      this method is very similar to the register method in ServerControllerRMI, basically is the method that a client has to call to make a connection with the server
      void startClientPinger()
      This method is called when the server starts, its job is to check if a client is disconnected (not declared disconnection, EG lost network connection (remoteException is thrown)) It's implemented as a scheduled timer to a fixed rate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionHandler

        public ConnectionHandler()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Default constructor, it builds all the data structures used to trace all the connections
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a network error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • askForConnection

        public InterfaceServerControllerRMI askForConnection​(InterfaceClientControllerRMI clientController,
                                                     java.lang.String nickname)
                                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                     InvalidInputException
        this method is very similar to the register method in ServerControllerRMI, basically is the method that a client has to call to make a connection with the server
        Specified by:
        askForConnection in interface InterfaceConnectionHandler
        Parameters:
        clientController - the client must give in input his clientController (also a remote object)
        nickname - the nicknama chosen by the user
        Returns:
        returns to the client the reference to the server controller (also a remote object)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when a network error occurs
        InvalidInputException - if the input is not correct
        See Also:
        InterfaceClientControllerRMI, InterfaceServerControllerRMI

      • startClientPinger

        public void startClientPinger()
        This method is called when the server starts, its job is to check if a client is disconnected (not declared disconnection, EG lost network connection (remoteException is thrown)) It's implemented as a scheduled timer to a fixed rate.
